detaileddescription.para: Custom counters, start the tracking of the wanted operation

parameterdescription.para: string key in the custom counter map
level of the counter you try to open, warning it changes the value of the level of the counter associated with custom_count_name

detaileddescription.para: Standard counters, start the tracking of the wanted operation

parameterdescription.para: level of the counter you try to open, warning it changes the value of the counter level associated with counter std_cnt

briefdescription.para: return time since start in seconds

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string counter_description, int counter_level, std::string counter_family="None", bool is_comm=false, bool is_gpu=false)
memberdef.name: create_custom_counter

briefdescription.para: Create a new counter and add it to the map of custom counters.

simplesect.para: If the counter description already exists, it will not create a new counter.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &custom_count_name, int count_increment=1, long int quantity_increment=0)
memberdef.name: end_count

briefdescription.para: End the count of a counter and update the counter values.

parameterdescription.para: is the counter to end the count
is the count increment. If not specified, then it is equal to 1
is the increment of custom variable quantity. If not specified, it is set to 0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const STD_COUNTERS &std_cnt, int count_increment=1, long int quantity_increment=0)
memberdef.name: end_count

briefdescription.para: End the count of a counter and update the counter values.

parameterdescription.para: is the counter to end the count
is the count increment. If not specified, then it is equal to 1
is the increment of custom variable quantity. If not specified, it is set to 0.

briefdescription.para: This function compute statistics per time steps of counters used at least once during a time step.

parameterdescription.para: is the current time step number

briefdescription.para: Set time_loop_ to false as we exit the time loop.
Update computation_time_ and return its value as a double (in seconds)
Give as a double the time (in second) elapsed in the operation tracked by the standard counter call name since the counter was last opened.
Give as a double the time (in second) elapsed in the operation tracked by the standard counter call name since the counter was last opened.
Give as a double the total time (in second) elapsed in the operation tracked by the custom counter call name.
Give as a double the total time (in second) elapsed in the operation tracked by the standard counter call name.
Check whether a counter is already running. Should rarely be used!
Function that encapsulate the two functions that writes the TU files.

parameterdescription.para: can only take three values: "Computation start-up statistics", "Time loop statistics" or "Post-resolution statistics"

briefdescription.para: Reset counters to zero, used between the start-up of the computation, the computation itself and the post-processing.
Restart all counters, has to be called on every processor simultaneously.
Start a clock, return a time_point, not a double.
, this function start statistics tracking for a time step. It has to be called at the start of each time step.
Set time_loop_ to true in order to account for cache properly.
Stop all counters, has to be called on every processor simultaneously.
The class Perf_counters is based on a phoenix singleton pattern. To access to the unique object inside the code, use the getInstance() function.
This class stores and manages counters in TRUST. It is a singleton.
